thread.title: Queen to attend church service at Sandringham
thread.title_full: Queen to attend church service at Sandringham

author: Press Association
title: Queen to attend church service at Sandringham
text:
Queen to attend church service at Sandringham 
Monarch was absent from services over Christmas and the New Year because of a heavy cold Queen Elizabeth II arrives at St Mary Magdalene church at Sandringham, Norfolk, on Sunday. Photograph: Chris Radburn/PA Press Associati  11.08 GMT First published   11.04   
The Queen has attended church for the first time since a heavy cold kept her away from services over the festive period. 
Wearing royal blue, the monarch arrived at St Mary Magdalene church, close to her Sandringham estate, on Sunday, having missed her regular appearances on Christmas Day and New Yearâ€™s Day because of the lingering respiratory illness. 
She and the Duke of Edinburgh had been forced to delay their journey from Buckingham Palace to their Norfolk estate in the days before Christmas after she fell ill. 
More details soon . . .
